The exception that is for example throwed again

member.summary: Determines wich node we are talking about

member.param: The type of node that we want to store

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a Yaml string and return a Yaml tree

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.Parse(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Parse a Yaml string from a textreader and return a Yaml tree

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a Yaml string from a textfile and return a Yaml tree

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.ToFile(System.String)
member.summary: Write a YAML tree to a file using UTF-8 encoding

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.ToFile(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Write a YAML tree to a file

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.Parse(Yaml.ParseStream,System.Boolean)
member.param:
Avoids ethernal loops while parsing implicit mappings. Implicit mappings are not rocognized by a leading character. So while trying to parse the key of something we think that could be a mapping, we're sure that if it is a mapping, the key of this implicit mapping is not a mapping itself.
NOTE: Implicit mapping still belong to unstable code and require the UNSTABLE and IMPLICIT_MAPPINGS preprocessor flags.

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.Write(Yaml.WriteStream)
member.summary: Writes a Yaml tree back to a file or stream
member.remarks: should not be called from outside the parser. This method is only public from inside the Sequence and Mapping Write methods.

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.ToString
member.summary: The ToString method here, and in all the classses derived from this class, is used mainly for debugging purpose. ToString returns a xml-like textual representation of the objects. It's very useful to see how a Yaml document has been parsed because of the disambiguous representation of this notation.

member.name: M:Yaml.Node.Info
member.summary: Node info returns a YAML node and is also mostly used for debugging the parser. This could be used for traversing the meta-info of another YAML tree

member.name: P:Yaml.Node.URI
member.summary: URI of this node, according to the YAML documentation.

member.name: P:Yaml.Node.Type
member.summary: Kind of node: mapping, sequence, string, ...

member.name: T:Yaml.Integer
member.summary: Class for storing a Yaml Integer node uri: tag:yaml.org,2002:int

member.name: T:Yaml.Scalar
member.summary: All Yaml scalars are derived from this class

member.name: M:Yaml.Scalar.Parse(Yaml.ParseStream)
member.summary:
Parses a scalar
Integer
String
Boolean
Null
Timestamp
Float
Binary
member.remarks: Binary is only parsed behind an explicit !!binary tag (in Node.cs)

member.name: M:Yaml.Integer.ParseBase(Yaml.ParseStream,System.UInt32,System.Int16)
member.summary: Parses a string with a given base (maximum 10)
member.remarks: This is not completly correct. For base10 the first char may not be a '_' The other bases allow this...

member.name: M:Yaml.Integer.Parse60(Yaml.ParseStream,System.Int16)
member.summary: Parses a string with base 60, without sign

member.summary: Test that the unsigned int fits in a signed int
member.param: Sign of the int where it must fit in

member.name: F:Yaml.Timestamp.timezone
member.summary: Represents the offset from the UTC time in hours
member.remarks: We use this extra variable for compatibility with Mono and .NET 1.0. .NET 2.0 has an extra property for System.Datetime for the timezone.

member.name: M:Yaml.Timestamp.#ctor(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Basic constructor that takes a given datetime

member.name: M:Yaml.Timestamp.#ctor(System.DateTime,System.Double)
member.summary: Basic constructor, that also gives the posibility to set a timezone
member.param: The offset, in hours,r to UTC that determine the timezone

member.param: The number of characters that the integer is expected to be.
The stream that will be parsed

member.name: M:Yaml.Timestamp.SkipChar(Yaml.ParseStream,System.Char)
member.summary: Skips a specified char, and throws an exception when another char was found.

member.name: M:Yaml.Timestamp.SkipWhitespace(Yaml.ParseStream)
member.summary: Skips the spaces * and tabs * in the current stream

member.name: T:Yaml.Null
member.summary: Class for storing a Yaml Null node tag:yaml.org,2002:null

member.name: T:Yaml.Float
member.summary: Class for storing a Yaml Float node tag:yaml.org,2002:float

member.name: M:Yaml.Float.ParseNaN(Yaml.ParseStream)
member.summary: Test for the value's nan, NaN and NAN in the stream. If found then it is placed inside the content. There is no more data excepted behind it

member.name: M:Yaml.Float.ParseInf(Yaml.ParseStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Test for the value's inf, Inf and INF in the stream. If found then it 'merged' with the sign and placed in the content. There is no more data excepted behind it.

member.name: M:Yaml.Float.ParseNumber(Yaml.ParseStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: If it is not Infinity or NaN, then parse as a number

member.name: M:Yaml.Float.ParseScient(Yaml.ParseStream)
member.summary: Parses the exponential part of the float

member.name: T:Yaml.Preprocessor
member.summary: The Preprocessor class Given a character stream, this class will walk through that stream. NOTE: Comments are not longer skipped at this level, but now in the last level instead. (because of problems with comments within the buffer) NOTE: Null characters are skipped, read nulls should be escaped. \0

member.name: T:Yaml.IndentationProcessor
member.summary: The indentation processor, This class divides the stream from the preprocessor in substreams, according to the current level of indentation.

member.name: M:Yaml.IndentationProcessor.Indent
member.summary: Request an indentation. When we meet a \n and the following line is more indented then the current indentationlever, then save this request

member.name: M:Yaml.IndentationProcessor.Next
member.summary: Go to the next parsable char in the stream

member.name: P:Yaml.IndentationProcessor.Char
member.summary: Reads the current char from the stream

member.name: T:Yaml.BufferStream
member.summary: Third stream processor, this class adds a buffer with a maximum size of 1024 chars. The buffer cannot encapsulate multiple lines because that could do strange things while rewinding/indenting

member.name: M:Yaml.BufferStream.Next
member.summary: Move to the next character in the parse stream.

member.name: M:Yaml.BufferStream.UsingBuffer
member.summary: Returns true when using a buffer

member.name: M:Yaml.BufferStream.NextInBuffer
member.summary: Returns true when the next char will still be in the buffer (after calling next)

member.name: M:Yaml.BufferStream.DestroyLookaheadBuffer
member.summary: Destroys the current lookaheadbuffer, if there is one

member.name: P:Yaml.BufferStream.LookaheadPosition
member.summary: Current position in the lookahead buffer

member.name: T:Yaml.DropComments
member.summary: Drop the comments (This is disabled when literal parsing is enabled)

member.name: M:Yaml.DropComments.Next
member.summary: Move to the next character in the parse stream.

member.name: T:Yaml.DropTrailingNewline
member.summary: This layer removes the trailing newline at the end of each (sub)stream

member.name: M:Yaml.DropTrailingNewline.Next
member.summary: Move to the next character in the parse stream.

member.name: M:Yaml.DropTrailingNewline.Next(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Move to the next character in the parse stream.

member.name: T:Yaml.ParseStream
member.summary:
Stops parsing at specific characters, useful for parsing inline structures like (for instance):
[aaa, bbb, ccc, {ddd: eee, "fff": ggg}]

member.name: M:Yaml.ParseStream.StopAt(System.Char[])
member.summary: Set the characters where we should stop.

member.name: M:Yaml.ParseStream.DontStop
member.summary: Unset the characters where we should stop.

member.name: M:Yaml.ParseStream.Next
member.summary: Move to the next character in the parse stream.

member.name: M:Yaml.ParseStream.Next(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Move to the next character in the parse stream.

member.name: P:Yaml.ParseStream.StopNow
member.summary: True when we have to stop here

member.name: T:Yaml.LookaheadBuffer
member.summary: The lookahead buffer, used by the buffer layer in the parser

member.name: M:Yaml.LookaheadBuffer.Append(System.Char)
member.summary: Append a character to the buffer

member.name: M:Yaml.LookaheadBuffer.ForgetThePast
member.summary: Remove characters from the buffer before the current character

member.name: P:Yaml.LookaheadBuffer.LastPosition
member.summary: The last possible postition which could be set

member.name: P:Yaml.LookaheadBuffer.MaxPosition
member.summary: The last possible position which could be set if the buffer where full

member.name: P:Yaml.LookaheadBuffer.Full
member.summary: True when the buffer is full

member.name: M:Yaml.Binary.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.remarks: This constructor only sets the reference, no new memory is allocated

member.name: M:Yaml.Binary.Parse(Yaml.ParseStream)
member.remarks: This is not an efficient method. First the stream is placed in a string. And after that the string is converted in a byte[]. If there is a fault in the binairy string then that will only be detected after reading the whole stream and after coneverting.

member.name: M:Yaml.Binary.ToString
member.remarks: The hexadecimal notation, 20 bytes for each line

member.name: M:Yaml.Binary.Write(Yaml.WriteStream)
member.summary: Write the base64 content to YAML
member.remarks: The lines are splitted in blocks of 20 bytes

member.name: P:Yaml.Binary.Content
member.remarks: There is no new memory allocated in the 'set'.
